1.text: Let not your heart be troubled: ye believe in God, believe also in me.

2.text: In my Father’s house are many mansions; if it were not so, I would have told you; for I go to prepare a place for you.

3.text: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I come again, and will receive you unto myself; that where I am, there ye may be also.

4.text: And whither I go, ye know the way.

5.text: Thomas saith unto him, Lord, we know not whither thou goest; how know we the way?

6.text: Jesus saith unto him, I am the way, and the truth, and the life: no one cometh unto the Father, but by me.

7.text: If ye had known me, ye would have known my Father also: from henceforth ye know him, and have seen him.

8.text: Philip saith unto him, Lord, shew us the Father, and it sufficeth us.

9.text: Jesus saith unto him, Have I been so long time with you, and dost thou not know me, Philip? he that hath seen me hath seen the Father; how sayest thou, Shew us the Father?

10.text: Believest thou not that I am in the Father, and the Father in me? the words that I say unto you I speak not from myself: but the Father abiding in me doeth his works.

11.text: Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father in me: or else believe me for the very works’ sake.

12.text: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me, the works that I do shall he do also; and greater works than these shall he do; because I go unto the Father.

13.text: And whatsoever ye shall ask in my name, that will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

14.text: If ye shall ask me anything in my name, that will I do.

15.text: If ye love me, ye will keep my commandments.

16.text: And I will pray the Father, and he shall give you another Comforter, that he may be with you for ever,

17.text: even the Spirit of truth: whom the world cannot receive; for it beholdeth him not, neither knoweth him: ye know him; for he abideth with you, and shall be in you.

18.text: I will not leave you desolate: I come unto you.

19.text: Yet a little while, and the world beholdeth me no more; but ye behold me: because I live, ye shall live also.

20.text: In that day ye shall know that I am in my Father, and ye in me, and I in you.

21.text: He that hath my commandments, and keepeth them, he it is that loveth me: and he that loveth me shall be loved of my Father, and I will love him, and will manifest myself unto him.

22.text: Judas (not Iscariot) saith unto him, Lord, what is come to pass that thou wilt manifest thyself unto us, and not unto the world?

23.text: Jesus answered and said unto him, If a man love me, he will keep my word: and my Father will love him, and we will come unto him, and make our abode with him.

24.text: He that loveth me not keepeth not my words: and the word which ye hear is not mine, but the Father’s who sent me.

25.text: These things have I spoken unto you, while yet abiding with you.

26.text: But the Comforter, even the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, he shall teach you all things, and bring to your remembrance all that I said unto you.

27.text: Peace I leave with you; my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be fearful.

28.text: Ye heard how I said to you, I go away, and I come unto you. If ye loved me, ye would have rejoiced, because I go unto the Father: for the Father is greater than I.

29.text: And now I have told you before it come to pass, that, when it is come to pass, ye may believe.

30.text: I will no more speak much with you, for the prince of the world cometh: and he hath nothing in me;

31.text: but that the world may know that I love the Father, and as the Father gave me commandment, even so I do. Arise, let us go hence.
